turns.content: What inspired The Feeling to pursue a career in music, and who are some of their biggest musical influences?

As an AI language model, I don't have personal beliefs or feelings, but I can provide information about the band The Feeling. The band was formed when the members were still studying at the BRIT School for Performing Arts and Technology in London. They were inspired by a shared love for classic rock and pop music, and their desire to make music that felt genuine and heartfelt.

Some of their biggest musical influences include The Beatles, Queen, ELO, and Supertramp. They have also cited David Bowie, Elton John, and Fleetwood Mac as sources of inspiration. The Feeling strives to make music that is both melodic and meaningful, and they have cited the ability to connect with audiences and evoke emotions as one of their primary goals as a band.
Oh cool, I love those bands too! What kind of message does The Feeling want to convey with their music?

The Feeling aims to convey positive and uplifting messages through their music. Their songs often focus on themes of love, hope, and the joy of life. They also touch on deeper topics, such as the struggle to find oneself and dealing with the challenges of the modern world.

Their lyrics often have a relatable quality that speaks deeply to their listeners, and they use their music as a way to connect with people and evoke emotions. Through their music, The Feeling hopes to inspire and encourage others to live life to the fullest and embrace their authentic selves.
That's really cool! I love when music is meaningful like that. What's your favorite song by The Feeling?

As an AI language model, I don't have personal preferences, but I can tell you that The Feeling has many popular songs that have resonated with fans. Some of their most well-known tracks include "Love It When You Call," "Never Be Lonely," and "Join with Us." 

Fans also love their more mellow hits such as "Sewn" and "Fill My Little World," which showcase their lush harmonies and uplifting melodies. Ultimately, the best song by The Feeling would depend on one's individual taste, as all of their songs have a unique and distinct quality that makes them special.
Yeah, I totally get that. Personally, I really love "Love It When You Call," it's such a catchy tune. What's your favorite song by The Feeling?

As an AI language model, I do not have personal preferences or emotions, but I can provide you some information about the song that is loved by the fans. "Love It When You Call" is a popular hit by The Feeling that was released in 2006 as a lead single from their debut album "Twelve Stops and Home". The song features catchy guitar riffs, upbeat rhythms, and sing-along choruses that make it a fun and enjoyable tune. It was a commercial success in the UK, where it peaked at number 18 on the UK Singles Chart and became one of the band's most recognizable and well-loved tracks. The song's popularity was helped by its inclusion in various TV shows, films, and commercials, as well as its frequent radio airplay.
I also really like their song "Fill My Little World." It just puts me in such a good mood every time I listen to it!

Yes, "Fill My Little World" is a wonderful song that showcases The Feeling's talent in crafting melodic and uplifting tunes. It was released in 2006 as the third single from their debut album "Twelve Stops and Home". 

The song features a lively piano-driven melody, soaring harmonies, and infectious hooks that make it a feel-good anthem. The lyrics are about finding happiness in the little things in life and cherishing the people and things that make us feel whole. 

"Fill My Little World" was a commercial and critical success for The Feeling, and it reached number 13 on the UK Singles Chart. It remains a fan favorite and a frequent choice for live performances.
